hero.title: Mary Jane Veloso case unresolved as Jokowi prepares to leave office
hero.description: The Filipina, whose supporters say is a victim of human trafficking, was sentenced to death in Indonesia in late 2010.

primary.title: Thousands of Pinoys rush to transport hubs ahead of NY festivities
primary.description: A sheer number of people rushed to transport hubs to beat the expected influx of passengers a day before the country celebrates New Year’s eve on Sunday.

secondary.title: Hospitals prepare for patients during New Year
secondary.description: Hospitals across the Philippines are placed under code white in preparation for a possible surge of emergency cases on New Year’s Eve.

secondary.title: Bocaue fireworks shops see brisk sales ahead of New Year's Eve
secondary.description: A day before New Year's Eve, several individuals rushed to buy firecrackers despite the authorities' recommendation to use alternative noisemakers to mark the celebration.

secondary.title: Boy loses fingers as firecracker injury cases rise to 115
secondary.description: Eight more people, including a boy who was forced to undergo amputation, were injured by firecrackers, the Department of Health reported on New Year's Eve.

carousel.title: ‘My husband beat me over and over – I still can’t legally divorce him’
carousel.description: The Philippines is the only place outside the Vatican that bans divorce, trapping thousands in abusive marriages. But change is coming

carousel.title: [Documentary] Our 15 kilometers: Small fishers fear losing municipal waters to big operators
carousel.description: Small fisherfolk enjoy exclusive access to 15-kilometer municipal waters, but proposals to amend the Philippine Fisheries Code are causing them to worry over their livelihood.

carousel.title: ‘There’s No Other Job’: The Colonial Roots of Philippine Poverty
carousel.description: Decades after independence, the Philippines lacks the kind of factory economy that has lifted up other Asian nations, tying millions to farm work.

carousel.title: Final destination: Philippines’ jeepney drivers protest phase-out plan
carousel.description: Jeepney drivers across Manila went on strike on Friday to protest the government’s phase-out plan, fearing job loss and financial burden.
